text:
Just saw a LinkedIn influencer flexing ‘Organic Growth’ with 65K+ followers... and all they’re doing is copy-pasting content from other creators.
Organic? More like Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V growth.

To all the jobseekers out there:
Every application. Every interview. Every awkward follow-up. The pressure? Unreal.
And that one thought never leaves — Am I not good enough?
Let me say this loud and clear: It’s not you. It’s the system.
A system where 60% of people don’t even hear back.
Your mental health matters more than a broken hiring pipeline.
Take a step back. Breathe. The dream job will find you. 🌻

Looking for a job on LinkedIn feels like online dating.
So many promises.
So much hope.
And yet... ghosted every time. ☠️

LinkedIn scams be like —
"Congratulations! You’ve been selected for a job you didn’t even apply for!"
And the cherry on top?
Rs. 50,000 for the “onboarding process.”
Thanks, but no thanks.

sapne dekhna achi baat hai,
lekin job ke sapne dekh ke bas 'interested' likhna,
yeh toh thoda zyada hi optimistic hai na?

Next time I read a LinkedIn influencer’s story, I’m starting from the last line.
If there’s a link there — I already know it’s fake marketing.
Saves time, saves sanity.

5–6 rounds of interviews.
Rejection after rejection.
Felt like a punch every time. All that prep, those sleepless nights — for what? Nothing?
But now I know better.
It wasn’t ‘nothing.’ It was the Universe saying:
“Not this one. Something better is coming.”
And every single time, it did.
What felt like a closed door? Was just redirecting me to something that fit me better.
So now when I hear a “no,” I don’t spiral. I pause, breathe, and trust.
There’s something bigger waiting.
Rejection isn’t always bad — sometimes, it’s just divine redirection.

To everyone still job hunting —
I see you. I feel you. 💔
Every rejection hits hard. Every “we’ll get back to you” feels like ghosting.
You’re not alone. 🌸
80% of jobseekers face anxiety and self-doubt. It’s real.
But this phase? It doesn’t define you.
Your worth ≠ offer letter. 💥
Please take breaks. Prioritize your peace.
Mental health > job title.

We need to stop thinking big companies = big talent.
Some of the most skilled, driven people I’ve worked with came from lesser-known places — no flashy names, just pure brilliance.
Meanwhile, I’ve seen folks at top companies feel lost, burnt out, or stuck.
It’s not the logo behind you. It’s the value you bring.
Especially for freshers — remember: skills > brand names.
Your happiness and growth come from doing what you love, not what looks good on paper.

When I finally quit that toxic job, I told my manager just one thing —
“Hope your son gets a manager like you.”
And I meant every word.
She always said she was a great manager, right?
Then this shouldn’t hurt.
Unless... you weren’t that great and you know it now. 🤷
If it felt like a curse, maybe ask yourself why.
Muskan - 1
Manager - 0
Aura boost 💯
(Fictional, sadly. But imagine the mic drop.)
Let’s be the kind of people our kids would actually want to work for. 🙏
Break the toxic cycle.
